elements.name: argument_text
elements.html: Paleoclimate data suggests that there have been large changes in Earth's climate many times in the past, including ice ages and warming spells long before human civilization. Changes in climate since the industrial revolution are small compared with ice ages. Therefore, the magnitude of global warming does not by itself provide evidence that industrialization and the burning of fossil fuels are causing the polar ice caps to melt.
